intro: Plectocomia icthyospinus, commonly known as the fish spine tree, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiny, woody structure that resembles the skeleton of a fish. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the warmer months, followed by fruit that contains edible seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research due to its adaptation to arid environments. However, it is considered endangered due to habitat loss and over-collection.
